entry.def: The headquarters of an organization are its main offices.

example.ex: ...fraud squad officers from London's police headquarters...
example.tran: 伦敦警察总部诈骗案调查组的警官们

example.ex: The building is the headquarters of the family firm.
example.tran: 这座大楼是该家族公司的总部。

means.word_mean: 1. (usually plural) the office that serves as the administrative center of an enterprise;

sentences.sentence: "many companies have their headquarters in New York"

means.word_mean: 2. (usually plural) the military installation from which a commander performs the functions of command;

sentences.sentence: "the general's headquarters were a couple of large tents"

means.word_mean: 3. (plural) a military unit consisting of a commander and the headquarters staff

auth_sentence.content: Lisa Schlein reports from Red Cross headquarters in Geneva.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Lisa Schlein reports from Red Cross headquarters in Geneva.

auth_sentence.content: Its headquarters, though, will remain in London.

means.word_mean: (机构, 企业等的)总部, 总店

sentences.en: The bank has its headquarters in Pairs.
sentences.cn: 这家银行的总行在巴黎。

sentences.en: The headquarters of the trade is[are] in London.
The general headquarters is in the suburbs.
